title: S&T Articles | Department Of Science & Technology

items.title: IIA celebrates 10 years of UVIT on AstroSat
items.summary:
- *IIA celebrates 10 years of UVIT on board AstroSat*, India's first dedicated space observatory launched in 2015.
- *UVIT* is a *twin telescope system* with *NUV/Vis* and *FUV*, delivering a large field and ~1.5 arcsec resolution, second only to *Hubble* in UV.
- It has observed 1,451 targets, produced ~300 papers and 19 PhD theses, with discoveries like Be-star companions, Blue Stragglers, and AGN feedback; data archived at ISRO's PRADAN.

items.title: Nanoplastics from single-use PET bottles harm gut bacteria and human Cells
R&D Roadmap to enable India's Net Zero Targets through Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (CCUS) launched
Supercharged COPs boost clean hydrogen production
items.summary: - Researchers used *argon plasma* to activate coordination polymers, creating *coordinatively unsaturated metal sites (CUMSs)* and boosting *OER* activity while preserving the COPs' bulk framework. - *Ni-based COPs* and *Co-based COPs* showed significantly improved electrocatalytic performance for *water splitting*, validated by XRD, TEM, XPS and other analyses, in the journal *ACS Applied Nano Materials*. - This *noble-metal-free* strategy offers a cost-effective route to durable, efficient catalysts for sustainable hydrogen production and broader clean-energy applications.

items.title: Kodaikanal Data Traces Solar Magnetic Activity
items.author: K.P. Raju, Apoorva Srinivasa, Anu Sreedevi, Narayanankutty Karuppath, P. Devendran, T. Ramesh Kumar, P. Kumaravel
items.summary:
- *Ca-K line data* from the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory (2015–2025) maps the *Sun's magnetic activity* across latitude bands, linking to the 11‑year cycle.
- Activity concentrates around ~40°N/S with strongest signals near 15–20°, plus notable *north–south hemispheric differences* that correlate with magnetic features and affect space weather.
- Findings reinforce predictable solar-cycle patterns and advance understanding of the *solar dynamo*, with outcomes relevant for satellite communication resilience.

items.title: Genetic clues to tackle oral cancer in Indian women revealed
items.summary:
- The study identifies a unique *CASP8* driver mutation with co-occurring *TP53* changes linked to aggressive oral cancer in Indian women (Kolar, Karnataka).
- Whole-exome sequencing plus *AI*-based analysis revealed two distinct tumor-immune profiles, suggesting tailored therapies.
- The cohort is small (N=38) and requires validation in larger studies; findings appear in Clinical and Translational Medicine (doi: 10.1002/ctm2.70386).

items.title: First block level climate vulnerability assessment in Meghalaya shows 25 blocks in high or very high vulnerability categories
Manipur bamboo fossil reveals Asia's Ice Age secret
items.summary:
- The 37,000-year-old bamboo fossil from Manipur preserves *thorn scars*, revealing Asia's Ice Age plant defenses.
- Its exceptional preservation shows Northeast India as a refugium during colder periods, aiding bamboo survival and local biodiversity.
- The finding advances *bamboo evolution* and *palaeoclimatic history*, highlighting regional refugia's lasting importance.

items.title: AI unlocks cancer's secrets for personalized therapy
items.summary:
- **OncoMark** reads the molecular *hallmarks* of cancer to predict behavior beyond size or stage.
- It analyzes 3.1 million single cells across 14 cancers to build synthetic 'pseudo-biopsies', showing how *metastasis*, *immune evasion*, and *genomic instability* drive growth and resistance.
- The framework achieved >99% accuracy across internal tests and 20,000 real-world samples, enabling targeted therapies and earlier intervention.

items.title: A decade of data from NASA unveils dramatic secrets of stellar infancy
